name: dotskill
description: Manager-Doer workflow with quality gates for Python development

skills.name: workflow-manager
skills.description: Manage Python development workflows with quality gates and decisions. Use when defining quality standards, evaluating code against gates, making accept/iterate/escalate decisions, or overseeing module development.

skills.name: workflow-developer
skills.description: Execute Python module development within a structured workflow. Use when implementing features, running tests, preparing code for review, or reporting progress through development iterations.

skills.name: workflow-reviewer
skills.description: Independently evaluate code quality and workflow compliance. Use when performing objective quality assessment, validating against quality gates, or providing recommendations for management decisions.

skills.name: python-development-workflow
skills.description: Orchestrate end-to-end Python development using the manager-doer pattern. Use when starting a new module or feature to understand the complete workflow from discovery through completion.

skills.name: gitops-workflow
skills.description: Manage git operations including branching strategies, conventional commits, and pull request workflows. Use when creating feature branches, writing commits, creating PRs, or managing development history.

skills.name: python-coding-standards
skills.description: Write production-quality Python code using established coding standards. Use when implementing modules, classes, or functions covering naming conventions, module layout, error handling, type hints, and design patterns.

skills.name: python-testing-standards
skills.description: Write effective Python tests using pytest and best practices. Use when creating test suites, designing test scenarios, handling edge cases, or ensuring comprehensive code coverage.

skills.name: python-layout
skills.description: Python project and module structure guidance. Use for consistent conventions for project structure, module organization, file naming, and code organization within files.

skills.name: literate-python
skills.description: Write Python code with literate programming annotations using Litterate-compatible #> markers. Use when writing code intended for human understanding, adding meaningful documentation without redundancy.

skills.name: unix-philosophy
skills.description: Unix philosophy principles for Python development. Use for composition over reimplementation, small focused modules, and leveraging existing tools.

skills.name: package-research
skills.description: Research existing packages before implementing. Use for systematic package discovery, evaluation, and build vs compose decisions.

skills.name: playground-exploration
skills.description: Playground-driven development using Knuth's dogfooding philosophy. Use when exploring APIs interactively, discovering features through usage, or converting experiments to tests.

skills.name: llmtxt-generation
skills.description: Create concise documentation for LLM consumption using the llms.txt standard. Use when onboarding packages, documenting APIs for AI assistants, or creating context-efficient reference materials.

skills.name: plugin-structure-reference
skills.description: Reference guide for Claude Code plugin directory structure and organization. Use when creating new Claude Code plugins, debugging plugin installation issues, or understanding how plugins should be structured.
